channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Traffic lights are out of sink, 14th April
item.description:
The problem with Elmbridge Court roundabout, traffic lights I’ve identified each traffic light number four and traffic light number five coming from Tempe in bowling towards Elmbridge Court roundabout. It’s where the new anti-skid surface has been laid. It’s obviously caused problems with the sensors. This in my understanding has been an issue all of last week unsure to why talent have not been able to identify this problem with the amount of traffic this has caused
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence blocking PRoW EBW2, 14th April
item.description:
This PRoW was closed due to building works and the closure expired on 26th August 2023. Access has not been restored and it appears a recent that an area on the Tithe Barn Centre side of this fence has added additional fencing blocking this route.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Plough Close, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: T lights let four cars through then go red, 14th April
item.description:
T lights timing to short. At elmbridge court roundabout Causing both lanes blocking from elmbridge court back to C&G roundabout and back to walls roundabout.Even backs onto eastern ave at peak times.Both weekends and weekdays.Its chronic .please sort it out
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole/dip, 14th April
item.description:
Hasnt really been fixed as i went over it again today. N51.88736 w2. 13105 southbound, with a40 traffic joining m5. you have to swerve into middle lane to avoid this pothole/dip
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Cyclists not enough time to cross bridge, 14th April
item.description:
Bamfurlong lane (north) traffic lights over the railway bridge. I can see this has been reported multiple times over the six months or so. It's still not been resolved. I nearly got totalled by a white van today. It can't be that difficult to just extend the green light time for cyclists to pass over the bridge without an accident. Please fix this. It's not the first time it's happened to me here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
